What are the features and capabilities of the Verus platform when it comes to launching and managing currencies, and how does it enable dynamic interactions between different blockchains?

The Verus platform provides a robust set of features for launching and managing currencies, making it easy to create and manage new tokens or currencies without requiring programming knowledge. Some of the key features of the Verus platform include:

* **Kickstarter-like minimums**: Currencies can be launched with minimum participation requirements, and if these requirements are not met, funds are automatically refunded.
* **Dynamic currency launch pricing**: The price of the currency is determined by the level of participation, and pre-launch participants can receive discounts.
* **Pre-conversion reserve currency carveouts**: A portion of the currency can be reserved for specific purposes or users.
* **Price-neutral launch pre-allocations**: The platform allows for pre-allocation of currencies without affecting the launch price.

Furthermore, the Verus platform enables currencies to be launched with various capabilities, such as accepting a range of other currencies and fractional reserve capabilities.

In addition to these features, the Verus platform is designed to enable seamless interactions between different blockchains. The Verus import/export protocol is designed to make integration with other blockchains easy and provable, and external bridges are being developed to enable automatic sending and receiving of Verus network tokens between Verus and ETH/ERC20 tokens.

The platform is also preparing for multi-chain, dynamic merge mining, which will enable Verus network chains to operate independently while still being dynamically merge mineable with up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash. This will earn rewards and power all chains simultaneously, and provide the same fractional currency capabilities for on-chain tokens and native zk-SNARK supporting currencies.

Overall, the Verus platform provides a powerful and flexible set of tools for launching and managing currencies, and enables dynamic interactions between different blockchains, making it an ideal platform for creating and managing new tokens or currencies.

# The Best Way to Launch a Currency
Currency launches with Kickstarter-like minimums to activate or, if not met, automatically refund, dynamic currency launch pricing, based on participation, pre-launch participation price discounts, pre-conversion reserve currency carveouts, and price-neutral launch pre-allocations, all specified in easy to understand commands and parameters, no programming necessary!Currencies can be launched to accept a range of other currencies and with or without fractional reserve capabilities. Verus import/export protocol was designed to make integration with other block chains provable and easy, and there are already external bridges in progress that expect to enable automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and ETH/ERC20 tokens, where currencies can be sent between Verus and ETH, expressed as Verus currencies on the Verus network, and exposed automatically on ETH as an ERC20 token.# Preparing for Multi-chain, Dynamic Merge Mining
While this 0.7.1 testnet enables on-chain token currency definition, the same advances will soon be available on the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology which was running on testnet last year. When enabled, this will make it possible for Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, earning rewards and powering all chains simultaneously. All network blockchains will provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens as well as native zk-SNARK supporting currencies as well.## Sending and Converting Currency
